meaningMnemonic: An <kanji>attempt</kanji> to <kanji>join</kanji> together isn't just any get together. Imagine two people boxing. They attempt to knock each other out when they join together. That's why this word is <vocabulary>game</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>match</vocabulary>. Did you watch the 試合 today? No! Don't tell me what happened, I recorded it on the VHS.
readingMnemonic: This word uses the on'yomi し for 試 and the kun'yomi あい for 合, which you learned with 場合. So you should be able to put them together!
